title: Middlesbrough F.C.
summary: Middlesbrough Football Club (/ˈmɪdəlzbrə/ (listen) MID-əlz-brə) is a professional football club in Middlesbrough, North Yorkshire, England, which competes in the EFL Championship, the second tier of English football. Formed in 1876, they have played at the Riverside Stadium since 1995.[2] The club played at Ayresome Park for 92 years, from 1903 to 1995.
